main event: A white cigar-shaped object was observed moving in a west to east direction at a fast pace near Louisville, Kentucky on June 7, 1961.
interesting points: The object was visible for about 15 minutes before fading out., It moved irregularly in altitude and emitted no sound or trail., The sighting was made by the pilot of a DC-6 aircraft and crew personnel., Senior director comments suggested the information might be hearsay and not specific., A strong possibility exists that the sighting could have been a weather balloon.
witness description: pilot of DC-6 Eastern 1253 and crew personnel
